prompt: 61yo F with hemoptysis. Bronchoscopy showed a polypoid lesion within the Right Upper Lobe bronchus. Did aspiration and bx of RUL bronchus. Dx: Endobronchial lesion RUL.

NOTE_ID: note_081 SOURCE_FILE: note_081.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 61-year-old female who presents with hemoptysis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

Consent Status: The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.
Discussion: Risks, benefits, and alternatives were discussed in detail.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D14.3 Benign neoplasm of bronchus and lung.
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D14.3 Benign neoplasm of bronchus and lung.

Endobronchial lesion RUL.

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode).

Diagnostic bronchoscopy with cell washing.
Endobronchial biopsy(s).

ANESTHESIA Monitored Anesthesia Care (MAC).

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None.

COMPLICATIONS None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Initial Airway Inspection The airway was inspected. The vocal cords were normal appearing.
Lidocaine was applied to the vocal cords and the airway.
Findings: The airway anatomy was notable for a polypoid lesion within the Right Upper Lobe bronchus.
There was partial obstruction of the RUL orifice at this site. The remainder of the airway was normal appearing to the segmental level bilaterally.
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out mucus from the following segments:

Vocal Cord

Subglottic

Trachea (Proximal 1/3, Middle 1/3, Distal 1/3)

Right Mainstem

Bronchus Intermedius

Left Mainstem

Carina

RUL Carina (RC1)

RML Carina (RC2)

LUL Lingula Carina (Lc1)

Left Carina (LC2)

Endobronchial Biopsy Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the RUL bronchus.
The lesion was successfully removed. Samples were sent for Pathology.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well.
There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMEN(S)

RUL endobronchial biopsies.

IMPRESSION/PLAN

61-year-old female presented for bronchoscopy for hemoptysis.

Airway inspection revealed a polypoid lesion within the Right Upper Lobe bronchus with partial obstruction of the RUL orifice;
remainder of airway normal.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus clearance across multiple segments.

RUL lesion biopsied.
Plan: Follow-up bronchoscopic lab work.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

Consent Status: The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.
Discussion: Risks, benefits, and alternatives were discussed in detail.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J44.9 Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J44.9 Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

Mucous plugging.

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode).

Diagnostic bronchoscopy with cell washing.
Endobronchial biopsy(s).

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None.

COMPLICATIONS None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Findings: The airway anatomy was notable for thick secretions throughout the bronchial tree.

Subglottic

Right Mainstem

Distal tracheal biopsies.
